text: Ellerbe Springs Hotel is a historic rural resort hotel located near Ellerbe, Richmond County, North Carolina. It was built around 1875 and is a two-story, three part, rambling frame dwelling in the Late Victorian style. It consists of a five bay central block with five bay flanking wings and steep hipped roofs. It features a one-story, wraparound porch. Also on the property is a contributing late-19th century dance pavilion. The hotel developed around a mineral spring. Eleanor Roosevelt was a visitor to the site in 1940, when she spoke of the president's National Youth Administration program. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1980. ==References== Category:Hotel buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Victorian architecture in North Carolina Category:Hotel buildings completed in 1875 Category:Buildings and structures in Randolph County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Richmond County, North Carolina
title: Ellerbe Springs Hotel
